titleInfo.title: Fairview home of Mrs. Chauncey C. Foster on Hillsboro Road, n.d.

mods.identifier: Wilk scrapbook pg 023 Fairview home 2nd c

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: This attractive seven-room home, located on the Hillsboro Road at Abbott Lane, in Nashville, Tennessee, was built for Mrs. Chauncey C. Foster. The residence was built upon the foundation of the old Foster home, after it was destroyed by fire circa 1933. The structure was designed by Henry C. Hibbs, architect, and built by Boone Construction Company. It was of then modern design of brick construction with a cement shingle roof. This residential home was located at 3901 Hillsboro Road at Abbott Martin Road, and was occupied as from 1933 until January, 1955. These digital reproductions were scanned from the scrapbook of Mrs. Frank A. Wilk (Alva Herbert Wilk). 1 digital photograph.

titleInfo.title: Mrs. Frank A. Wilk Digital Photographs Collection
